intro: Polygala brachystachya, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Mediterranean. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, legume-like fruits. Polygala brachystachya is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
